intro: Descurainia halictorum var. andrenarum, commonly known as the yellow bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. This variety is often associated with pollinators like bees due to its nectar-rich flowers.
